DOC.brief_summary: Background : Facet intervention second commonly perform procedure pain clinic throughout U.S , include military . Currently , clear consensus regard whether intra-articular ( IA ) block medial branch block ( facet joint nerve ; MBB ) best way diagnose treat facetogenic pain , even whether perform diagnostic/ prognostic block . Hypothesis : IA block provide good relief MBB , MBB may better select patient radiofrequency denervation . Purpose : Objective 1 : Determine `` prognostic '' block best predictor RF denervation outcome ; Objective 2 : To determine whether add steroid IA MBB may provide intermediate long-term benefit subset individual . Research Design : Randomized , comparative-effectiveness study Methodology /Technical Approach : A total 225 patient non-radicular chronic low back pain ( LBP ) suspect facetogenic etiology randomize 2:2:1 ratio one 3 group : Group 1 receive IA block steroid LA Group 2 receive MBB steroid LA Group 3 receive MBB saline Those individual obtain significant ( â‰¥ 50 % group 1 2,3 ) temporary ( < 1-month ) relief undergo radiofrequency ( RF ) denervation 1-month follow-up . In group 3 , patient experience pain relief 1-month undergo RF denervation regardless pain relief experience ( many practitioner military civilian practice without diagnostic block ) .1-3 Participants Groups 1 2 experience prolonged relief diagnostic/ therapeutic block LA steroid undergo RF denervation pain return . Those individual experience prolonged relief last > 6 month give option repeat diagnostic/ therapeutic block . In Groups 1 , 2 3 patient experience prolonged relief diagnostic block , follow-up visit 1-month , 3-months 6-months block , pain relief wear . In undergo denervation base positive block , follow-up perform 1 , 3 6-months denervation provide continue experience significant ( > 50 % ) relief follow-up . Those individual fail experience significant relief denervation unblinded exit study per protocol .
DOC.brief_title: Medial Branch Blocks vs. Intra-articular Injections : Randomized , Controlled Study
DOC.detailed_description: Two hundred twenty five patient suspect lumbar facet arthropathy schedule undergo diagnostic lumbar facet block enrol study WRNMMC randomize 2:2:1 ratio one 3 group . Group 1 receive IA block steroid LA , group 2 receive MBB steroid LA , group 3 receive MBB saline . Subjects ( inject physician ) evaluator blind throughout participation study treatment allocation . The nerve joint block determined physical exam ( i.e . location paraspinal tenderness ) , radiological finding . Group 1 : The 80 patient group undergo IA block fluoroscopic guidance 0.5 mL solution contain 50:50 mixture 0.5 % bupivacaine 10 mg depomethylprednisolone ( call `` steroid '' ) . In case , correct position confirm administration contrast . After block , administer pain diary maintain next 6 hour . In accordance standard care , positive response > 50 % pain relief last least 3 hour . Patients undergone physical therapy ( PT ) send PT . The first follow-up 1-month . In individual positive block whose pain return baseline , RF denervation perform level do diagnostic block . Once adequate sensory stimulation confirm , 1 mL mixture contain equal amount 2 % lidocaine 0.5 mL ) 20 mg depo-methylprednisolone ( 0.5 mL ) inject reduce procedure-related pain decrease incidence neuritis . For patient persistent ( > 50 % ) pain relief 1-month , return 2nd follow-up 3-months . If pain relief persists point , final follow-up 6-months post-procedure . Pain relief group last > 6 month treat repeat IA injection patient desire , persists < 6 month treat RF denervation . Patients experience negative diagnostic block , fail obtain significant pain relief follow-up RF denervation , exit study per protocol pursue alternative treatment Group 2 : The 80 patient group undergo MBB block fluoroscopic guidance 0.5 mL solution contain 50:50 mixture 0.5 % bupivacaine 10 mg depo-methylprednisolone steroid . After block , administer pain diary maintain next 6 hour . Patients undergone physical therapy send PT program . The first follow-up 1-month . In individual experience significant pain relief , RF denervation perform level do diagnostic block , describe 'Group 1 ' . For patient persistent ( > 50 % ) pain relief 1-month , return 2nd follow-up 3-months . If pain relief persists point , final follow-up 6-months post-procedure . Pain relief group last > 6 month treat repeat MBB desire , persist < 6 month treat RF denervation . Patients experience negative diagnostic block , fail obtain significant pain relief follow-up RF denervation , exit study per protocol pursue alternative treatment . Group 3 : The 40 patient group undergo IA block fluoroscopic guidance 0.5 mL normal saline . After block , administer pain diary maintain next 6 hour . Patients undergone physical therapy send PT . The first follow-up 1-month . In individual fail experience significant pain relief time point , RF denervation perform level do diagnostic block , describe 'Group 1 ' . For patient persistent ( > 50 % ) pain relief 1-month , return 2nd follow-up 3-months . If pain relief persists point , final follow-up 6-months post-procedure . Pain relief block group last > 6 month treat repeat MBB , persist < 6 month treat RF denervation . In patient experience significant pain relief 1-month follow-up , RF denervation perform . Those experience negative outcome RF denervation , exit study per protocol pursue alternative treatment . During follow visit , subject difficulty arrange transportation elect conduct follow-up visit telephone , via fax , e-mail , whichever convenient .
DOC.criteria: Age > 18 year Suspected lumbar facet arthropathy base history physical exam ( e.g . axial low back pain , paraspinal tenderness , pain referral knee ) NRS back pain score > 4 ; MRI evidence spinal pathology consistent symptom . Untreated coagulopathy No MRI study Signs symptom cauda equina syndrome Focal neurological sign symptom Allergic reaction local anesthetic contrast dye Serious medical condition might preclude optimal outcome Pregnancy
